articles.title: African leaders urge Putin to end blockade of Ukraine's grain - The Washington Post
articles.description: Putin's move has heightened fears that the blockade will lead to a spike in food prices, worsening a global food security emergency in the Horn of Africa.

articles.title: Niger army endorses presidential coup plotters despite international condemnation - CNN
articles.description: Niger’s military has backed coup leaders who have claim to have seized power in the West African country, prompting warnings from the international community.

articles.title: After Withdrawal From Black Sea Grain Deal, Russia's New Offer To Africa - NDTV
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday offered free grain to six poor African countries as he launched a summit with leaders from the continent days after withdrawing from the Ukraine grain export deal.
articles.content:
Putin promised to send grain to six African countries.

articles.title: Isolated Putin tries to shore up African support as Kremlin seethes over poor summit turnout - CNN
articles.description: A summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and African leaders began in St. Petersburg on Thursday, with a far lower turnout than previous years.
articles.content:
